remarks: Part of proof after Lemma N of [Crawley] p. 122.  Reverse ordering property.  Todo: do we need ` -. X .<_ W ` and ` -. Y .<_ W ` ? (Contributed by NM, 4-Mar-2014.)
statement:
dihord2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
dihord2.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
dihord2.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
dihord2.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
dihord2.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
dihord2.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dihord2.i $e |- I = ( ( DIsoB ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihord2.J $e |- J = ( ( DIsoC ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihord2.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihord2.s $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` U ) $.
dihord2 $p |- ( ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ ( Q e. A /\ -. Q .<_ W ) /\ ( N e. A /\ -. N .<_ W ) ) /\ ( X e. B /\ Y e. B ) /\ ( ( Q .\/ ( X ./\ W ) ) = X /\ ( N .\/ ( Y ./\ W ) ) = Y /\ ( ( J ` Q ) .(+) ( I ` ( X ./\ W ) ) ) C_ ( ( J ` N ) .(+) ( I ` ( Y ./\ W ) ) ) ) ) -> X .<_ Y ) $.
